result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Gallatin, Alexander Y

records.addlTxt: Filed by Emily Marhan, M.S. and Dr. Grusecki
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed by Judge Dennis P Moroney October 17, 2022.

Filed by Atty Thompson withdrawing the request for an involuntary medication order.  **Reviewed by Judge Moroney 10/17/22 - Based on letter from the State and email confirmation from Defense the Court will approve the request to withdraw the involuntary medications order with respect to the Order for Treatment.**
Review hearing on December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
8:41 AM; Case called for Review hearing.  Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Mendota.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Alexander Y Gallatin.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Court notes it has received a copy of the competency report from Milwaukee County and notes that all counsel have agreed to use the findings in that report for this matter.  State confirms they have agreed to use the competency report from Milwaukee County and do not contest the findings.  State also notes in the Milwaukee County case there is an order for involuntary administration of medication and is requesting that order also be put in place in this matter as well.  Atty. Tapia confirms he will accept the findings in the Milwaukee County competency report and is not contesting the findings.  Based on there being no contest and based on the findings in the Competency report from Milwaukee County dated 08/15/2022 the Court will find the defendant is not competent to proceed but likely to become competent with treatment.  Court orders the proceedings be suspended and defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services. Court will also order involuntary administration of medications.  Court believes the matter should be adjourned about 90 days out for status.  Atty. Tapia responds and is asking the matter be set for a date shortly after the updated report in the defendant's Milwaukee County cases is due.  No objection by State for matter to be set in about 30 days, which is the return for the updated report from Milwaukee Co.  Court will schedule the matter about 45 days out noting if the matter needs to be set for a sooner date based on the findings in the Milwaukee Co. case the Court can do so.  Defendant to appear by video from Mendota or other Facility he is currently in for the next court date.
Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Filed by Atty. Tapia requesting to have the 10/17/2022 review hearing adjourned to a date after 11/15/2022.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 10/13/22 - Matter needs to stay on for 10/17/22 to address formal findings with respect to competency.**

Copy of the Competency evaluation report done by Dr. Sanchez in the defendant's Milwaukee County cases.
Review hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee County Jail
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

3:49 PM Defendant Alexander Y Gallatin appeared by video from Mendota, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikki Kane. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. 
COURT REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Doctor's report from Milwaukee County case to be used if possible, if not a report should be ordered be the trial court.
Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
